Facebook and other tech platforms have revolutionized the way we communicate.   Unfortunately that connectivity has also been used to dehumanize and stoke violence against Muslims and other communities. We urge Facebook to step up its efforts to fight hate speech and violence.

While we recognize Facebook has taken certain steps in response to these concerns it should:  ❌ Develop and publish additional metrics needed to evaluate the effectiveness of its responses; and   ❌ Adequately enforce its “call to arms” policy to help prevent violence.

The enabling of hate speech and violence against any group is unacceptable.   Today I led more than a dozen colleagues in sending a letter to @Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg calling for the company to take immediate action to combat anti-Muslim bigotry on its platform. https://t.co/WIuCOUHtRi

According to the COVID-19 Eviction Defense Fund between 19-23 million renters are at risk of evictions by September 30.

@DerrickNAACP @NAACP @dianeyentel @NLIHC @just_shelter @evictionlab @MyHomeMatters @urbaninstitute Congress has taken some steps to help but not enough. We passed a federal temporary ban on evictions in the last relief bill but it only applies to a small set of families and is set to expire on 7/24. Worse more than half of the country has no statewide eviction ban in place.

This morning I had an important challenging conversation with @DerrickNAACP from the @NAACP @dianeyentel from the @NLIHC @just_shelter from the @evictionlab and @MyHomeMatters from the @urbaninstitute about the steps we need to take to address the housing crisis.

In addition to decades of bad policies that have made it harder for families of color to own a home and build wealth we’re now facing a crisis for families who rent:   17% of renters couldn’t pay their June rent and 32% likely can’t pay this month’s rent.
We’ve seen data that shows us that these housing figures are worsening disproportionately for communities of color during the pandemic.

Before COVID-19 hit affordable and fair housing was already a problem. Nearly 11 million households paid more than half of their incomes towards housing and Black and LatinX homeownership rates were 30 percent lower than those of white families.

As a country we’ve been having important long overdue discussions about systemic racism and one of the areas where persistent racial inequality exists is in HOUSING.   It’s a crisis for Black and brown communities – and it’s getting a LOT worse during this pandemic.

It’s clear that our institutions that are supposed to provide justice for every American have failed. We must do more than repair them - we must remake them stronger than ever before.

This $377 billion small business package is one of the most important components of economic relief during #COVID19. Here are some things we’re delivering: ✅ $17B in debt relief for small biz ✅ access to $349B in loans forgiven based on employee retention ✅ $10B in grants

Republicans and Democrats need to stand up together and say clearly that we will not tolerate foreign interference in our elections.   This is a principle as old as our country itself and if we lose sight of it we are lost.
Regardless of what happens in this impeachment trial – we can’t let this slide.
China's listening too: they’re hearing loud and clear that they can get away with helping President Trump with his re-election campaign and it might help them in their trade negotiations with us.
Russia’s listening – they’re hearing loud and clear that they should continue to help the President’s campaign.
Let’s be clear about what Russia and China just heard – an invitation.
This is the President’s counsel on the floor of the United States Senate saying that it’s OK for the President to use information from foreign governments including hostile ones to get elected.

And: "Information that is credible that potentially shows wrongdoing by someone who happens to be running for office if it’s credible information is relevant information for the voters to know about for people to be able to decide on who is the best candidate for an office.”
Here's the exact quote: “I think that the idea that any information that happens to come from overseas is necessarily campaign interference is a mistake.”

Patrick Philbin a member of the President’s legal team started by dodging the question but then he said something that made my jaw drop: he said effectively that it’s OK for the President to accept and then use dirt on other candidates that he gets from foreign countries.

So – I asked the President’s lawyers a simple question: does the President agree with the statement in your brief that foreigners’ involvement in American elections is illegal?    This is where it gets disturbing.

That’s why I was surprised – and even encouraged – when the President’s lawyers said in their impeachment trial brief:    ‘Congress has forbidden foreigners’ involvement in American elections’. https://t.co/gnQ2YLXKfl

Then back to the case at hand: in July 2019 President Trump demanded over the phone that Ukrainian President Zelensky “do us a favor” by opening an investigation into President Trump’s leading political opponent former Vice President Joe Biden.
President Trump also stated then that he might not alert the FBI because: “Give me a break.”

In June 2019 Pres. Trump said that if Russia or China offered information on his opponent ‘[t]here’s nothing wrong with listening” and that “if somebody called from a country Norway [and said] ‘we have information on your opponent’ – oh I think I’d want to hear it.”

Remember - in July 2016 Pres. Trump in response to a question about reports that Russia was behind the theft of emails from the DNC said “Russia if you’re listening I hope you’re able to find the 30000 emails that are missing” from Hillary Clinton’s private email server.

First – some context.    We’re conducting this impeachment trial to determine whether President Trump abused his power and worked with a foreign government (Ukraine) to interfere in our 2020 election but we’ve seen President Trump do similar things before.
